items.sentence: You can\'t make an omelet without breaking eggs.
You can\'t really expect Tom to change his mind.
You didn\'t seem to enjoy the concert very much.
Tom doesn\'t think he\'ll be able come tomorrow.
Tom doesn\'t understand what you\'re driving at.
Tom will get a better job with a college degree.
We can communicate with each other in many ways.
We\'ll have lived here for two years next April.
We\'re playing tag. Do you want to play with us?
I\'ll play tennis with Tom later this afternoon.
I\'ve been studying French for a very long time.
I\'ve been waiting for the bus for half an hour.
Do you think this looks like Tom\'s handwriting?
I told Tom that the party wouldn\'t be much fun.
Tom and I weren\'t the only ones who complained.
Do you have any idea why Tom doesn\'t like Mary?
Do you know how long I\'ve been waiting for Tom?
Tom said he couldn\'t remember that guy\'s name.
Tom still hasn\'t found what he was looking for.
Tom doesn\'t seem to get along well with anyone.
